page.title: 06Clubs in Cropredy
page.content: There is a drama group called the Harlequins.They usually do two plays each year plus a pantomime involving the children of the village.They also take part in charity shows like the Banbury Round Table's,Good Old Day's production, which has become a yearly event. The Jubilee singers, formed in Jubilee year,are a group of about 30 women and men,who sing everything from Gilbert & Sullivan to anthems. They also do charity shows and concerts. Once a month there is a whist drive in the village hall. The Women's Institute meet once a month,as do the Over 60's,who go on regular outings which are very popular. A bus calls twice a week to go to play Bingo in a nearby village. The Girl Guides and Brownies meet every Monday evening.The Beavers,Scouts and cubs all meet in nearby villages.
